TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void WebPartEventHandler(object sender, WebPartEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed WebPartEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub WebPartEventHandler(sender As Object, e As WebPartEventArgs)
public delegate void WebPartEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, WebPartEventArgs ^ e);
type WebPartEventHandler = delegate of obj * WebPartEventArgs -> unit

param.name: e
param.span: Objeto que contiene los datos del evento.

span.span: A that contains the event data.

summary.span: Representa el método que controlará los eventos , , , o de un objeto .

span.span: Represents the method that will handle the event, event, event, event, or event of a object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks El método especificado en el se llama al delegado cuando un eventos, eventos, eventos, eventos, o evento se desencadena.The method specified in the delegate will be called when a event, event, event, event, or event is raised. Los desarrolladores de páginas pueden proporcionar controladores personalizados para los eventos de elementos Web agregando un `OnWebPartAdded` atributo, `OnWebPartDeleted` atributo, `OnWebPartClosed` atributo, `OnWebPartMoved` atributo, o `OnSelectedWebPartChanged` atribuir a la `` elemento en una página y asignarle un nombre de método personalizado al atributo.Page developers can provide custom handlers for Web Parts events by adding an `OnWebPartAdded` attribute, `OnWebPartDeleted` attribute, `OnWebPartClosed` attribute, `OnWebPartMoved` attribute, or `OnSelectedWebPartChanged` attribute to the `` element in a page, and assigning a custom method name to the attribute. También puede asignar un controlador personalizado mediante programación.A custom handler can also be assigned programmatically. Para obtener más información acerca de la asignación mediante programación un controlador de eventos, vea [NIB: Cómo: conectar métodos de controlador de eventos a eventos](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/348e9600-22e3-49a2-8864-11c5bb3e98fc).For more information on programmatically assigning an event handler, see [NIB: How to: Connect Event Handler Methods to Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/348e9600-22e3-49a2-8864-11c5bb3e98fc).
